questions.question: Who is a vet?
questions.answer: A doctor for animals

questions.question: What must a competent vet possess?
questions.answer: Wide knowledge

questions.question: Which animal refuses milk in the poem?
questions.answer: Cat

questions.question: Which bird sings faintly according to the poem?
questions.answer: Canary

questions.question: Which animal has trouble with its feet?
questions.answer: Centipede

questions.question: Which animal is said to suffer from cold?
questions.answer: Lion

questions.question: Which animal is said to suffer from heat?
questions.answer: Arctic fox

questions.question: Why is the vet called omniscient?
questions.answer: He treats all animals

questions.question: Who wrote the poem The Vet?
questions.answer: Guy Boas

questions.question: What is the tone of the poem?
questions.answer: Humorous

questions.question: Why is the vet called omniscient?
questions.answer: He treats all animals

questions.question: Who wrote the poem The Vet?
questions.answer: Guy Boas

questions.question: What is the tone of the poem?
questions.answer: Humorous

questions.question: Why is a vet’s job described as difficult?
questions.answer: Because animals cannot speak and explain their problems.

questions.question: Why does the poet call the vet omniscient?
questions.answer: He must understand many animals and their illnesses.

questions.question: Why does the cat refuse milk?
questions.answer: It is unwell and suffering from illness.

questions.question: Why does the canary sing faintly?
questions.answer: It is sick and weak.

questions.question: What problem does the centipede face?
questions.answer: It has trouble with its many feet.

questions.question: Why is the lion said to suffer from cold?
questions.answer: The poet humorously points out opposite problems in animals.

questions.question: Why does the Arctic fox suffer from heat?
questions.answer: It is not suited to warm conditions.

questions.question: Why is the vet’s reward said to be small?
questions.answer: He works hard but earns little money.

questions.question: What tone is used by the poet?
questions.answer: A light-hearted and humorous tone is used.

questions.question: What lesson does the poem teach?
questions.answer: We should respect the hard work of veterinarians.
